body:
The most impactful way to build leverage for your startup is by understanding your users. I love how @paulgharwood frames it:

"When you are trying to understand the user, what you are really trying to do is understand their problem better".

💥 Actionable tips to get started 🧵

3 Essentials for Aspiring Women Entrepreneurs 🙌 Tips from our Founder & CEO Jade O’Hearn (1/4)

#Entrepreneur #entrepreneurlife #startup

If this tip can save one person's life it will be worth it........

How do I disable the Microsoft team from starting at start up?

1) Press Ctrl + Shift + Esc key to open Task Manager.

2) Go to Startup tab.

3) Click on Microsoft Teams, and click on Disable.

Pleasure!

An important #NewPI tip given to me that has paid major dividends: independently track every bit of your spending (startup, grants, etc).   As many details as you can. 

Administrative discrepancies will never favor you, have the receipts.
Product managers: what’s the #1 tip you have for startup CEOs running product?

Pro Tip: If you’re starting a care delivery startup, don’t overlook hiring a top network contracting leader.

Often overlooked relative to product, clinical, and biz dev, but network dev is critical to success.

Pro tip for new founders:

Buy all your enterprise software in the last week of the quarter.

1. Sales has to hit quota or they won’t make money

2. Startups have to hit targets or they won’t raise venture

3. Public companies have to hit earnings goals or their stock falls

Tip of the day! Stop taking a dependency on IConfiguration! Only your Program and Startup class should use this interface. Any other service should have well defined configuration requirements! Don't make people traverse your entire codebase to find what config is needed!

Spoke with a founder who wants to "gamify" his startup SAAS idea AKA "Make it like Peleton - shouldn't be that hard..." 🤔

Sigh. 

PRO TIP:  copying an existing progression system & aggregate metric from one situation and plunking it into another is NOT the path to success 📉

There's been a huge NVIDIA GPU shortage, & I work w/a few startups that are having a hard time buying enough chips. Does anyone have good tips/resources for buying hundreds of GPUs? Most of these companies are especially interested in the GTX 1650, but also in any general advice.

Productivity tip:
Use coffee cups as story points to measure how difficult a task is

Task 1: ☕️☕️☕️☕️☕️
Task 2: ☕️☕️☕️
Task 3: ☕️☕️☕️☕️

#dev #startups

It's common to hear from VCs that they are "industry agnostic", yet I have found out by experience that this is not always the case. So here 3 tips on how to improve the communication between VCs and entrepreneurs 👇🏽 #startup #investment

@paulg Hi Paul, I am a newly-turned angel Investor. I am looking a very promising India startup and would love to invest in. But I am personally lacking enough resources to do DD. Any tips for small angels like me towards India startups?

@CydneyMar @Startup_Canada @MastercardCA Another tip if you met the criteria get set up as @WBECanada @BCorporation @camsc_org certified - they can make your org standout amongst a list suppliers. All gov'ts and corporates are looking for diversity in their supplier base. #startupchats @Startup_Canada @MastercardCA

One of my portfolio companies was struggling

I knew it

The founder knew it

The market knew it

It was time to dig in. I rolled up my sleeves

I gave one tip - just one

SOC 2 compliance from @secureframe

That was years ago

Today? It's the fastest growing startup in the world

Quick tip for founders. A week ago or so I mentioned if you are having a 30 min meeting with an investor to keep your pitch to no more than 10 mins. Well with that last 20 mins you'll want to keep your answers to that investor's questions to 2 mins or less. #vc #funding #startups
